Publications

Group highlights

(For a full list see below or go to Google Scholar).

COVID-19: therapeutics and their toxicities

Review of mechanism of actions hydroxychloroquine, chlorquine, nucleotide analogs, nucleic acid vaccines, and how to treat overdoses or toxicity from them.

MA Chary, AF Barbuto, S Izadmehr, BD Hayes, MM Burns

Journal of Medical Toxicology. 16(3), 10.1007 (epub)

 

Full List

  1. Chary, M., & Burns, M. (2020). using Artificial Intelligence To Understand Recreational Drug Usage And Toxicity From Internet Forums. Clinical Toxicology, 58(6), 547–548.
  2. Chary, M., Genes, N., & Manini, A. (2013). Characteristics Of Twitter Conversations On Illicit Drug Use. Clinical Toxicology, 51(4), 349–349.
  3. Chary, M. (2012). A Computational Model Of The Effects Of Drug Addiction On Neural Population Dynamics. Arxiv Preprint Arxiv:1209.3411.
  4. mascitelli, J. R., Polykarpou, M., Moyle, H., Chary, M., Gologorsky, Y., Patel, A., Kamath, A., Doshi, A., & Patel, A. (2013). An Update To The Raymond Classification Of Intracranial Aneurysms. Journal Of Neurosurgery, 119(2), a568–a568.
  5. genes, N., Chary, M., & Chason, K. W. (2013). An Academic Medical Center’s Response To Widespread Computer Failure. Am J Disaster Med, 8(2), 145–150.
  6. Chary, M., Park, E. H., Mckenzie, A., Sun, J., Manini, A. F., & Genes, N. (2014). Signs & Symptoms Of Dextromethorphan Exposure From Youtube. Plos One, 9(2).
  7. genes, N., Chary, M., & Chason, K. (2014). Analysis Of Twitter Users’ Sharing Of Official New York Storm Response Messages. Medicine 2.0, 3(1).
  8. Chary, M., & Kaplan, E. (2014). Synchrony Can Destabilize Reward-sensitive Networks. Frontiers In Neural Circuits, 8, 44.
  9. Chary, M., Genes, N., & Manini, A. F. (2014). Using Twitter To Measure Underage Alcohol Usage. Clinical Toxicology, 52(4), 304–304.
  10. Chary, M., & Kopell, B. (2014). Why Does Deep Brain Stimulation Do The Same Thing In The Stn And Gpi? A Computational Study Of Deep Brain Stimulation In The Basal Ganglia. Stereotact. Funct. Neurosurg., 92(suppl 1), 1–75.
  11. holloway, T., Lorsch, Z. S., Chary, M. A., Sobotka, S., Moore, M. M., Costa, A. B., Del Maestro, R. F., & Bederson, J. (2015). Operator Experience Determines Performance In A Simulated Computer-based Brain Tumor Resection Task. International Journal Of Computer Assisted Radiology And Surgery, 10(11), 1853–1862.
  12. Chary, M., Genes, N., Giraud-carrier, C., Hanson, C., Nelson, L., & Manini, A. F. (2015). Estimating Nonmedical Use Of Prescription Opioids In The Usa From Social Media. Clinical Toxicology, 53(4), 371–372.
  13. lee, S., Chary, M., Petersen, B., & Mascarenhas, J. (2015). Paraneoplastic Orthostatic Hypotension Associated With Acute Myeloid Leukemia. Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci, 19(15), 2934–2937.
  14. lee, S., & Chary, M. (2015). Irony Of Transfusional Support For Refractory Anemia In Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis. Journal Of Investigative Medicine, 63(4), 675–676.
  15. Lee, S., Chary, M., Petersen, B., & Mascarenhas, J. (2015). Paraneoplastic Orthostatic Hypotension Associated With Acute Myeloid Leukemia With Trisomy 8. Journal Of Investigative Medicine, 63(4), 688–689.
  16. Lee, S., Salehi, I., Chary, M., Schiano, T., & Mascarenhas, J. O. (2016). “Irony” Of Managing Refractory Anemia With Transfusional Support In Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis. Transfusion And Apheresis Science, 55(1), 105–108.
  17. Devraj, N., & Chary, M. (2015). How Do Twitter, Wikipedia, And Harrison’s Principles Of Medicine Describe Heart Attacks? Proceedings Of The 6th Acm Conference On Bioinformatics, Computational Biology And Health Informatics, 610–614.
  18. Genes, N., Chary, M., & Chason, K. (2013). Analysis Of Twitter Users’ Sharing Of Official New York City Preparedness Messages During The Sandy Storm: 652. Academic Emergency Medicine, 20.
  19. Lee, S., Salehi, I., Chary, M., Schiano, T., & Mascarenhas, J. (2015). “Irony” Of Managing Refractory Anemia With Transfusional Support In Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis. Pediatric Blood & Cancer, 62.
  20. Chary, M., Leuthauser, A., Hu, K., & Hexom, B. (2017). Differences In Self-expression Reflect Formal Evaluation In A Fourth-year Emergency Medicine Clerkship. Western Journal Of Emergency Medicine, 18(1), 174.
  21. Chu, K., Leuthauser, A., Chary, M., & Hexom, B. (2015). Do Reflective Students Learn More In The Emergency Department? Annals Of Emergency Medicine, 66(4), s30.
  22. leuthauser, A., Chary, M., Hexom, B., & Hu, K. (2015). Does The Extent Of Medical Student Reflection Correlate With Their Grade In An Emergency Medicine Clerkship? Western Journal Of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care With Population Health, 16(4.1).
  23. Chary, M., & Manini, A. (2017). Linguistic Differences Between Spanish And English Tweets That Mention Opioids. Clinical Toxicology, 55(5), 427–428.
  24. Chary, M., Genes, N., Giraud-carrier, C., Hanson, C., Nelson, L. S., & Manini, A. F. (2017). Epidemiology From Tweets: Estimating Misuse Of Prescription Opioids In The Usa From Social Media. Journal Of Medical Toxicology, 1–9.
  25. Chary, M., Yi, D., & Manini, A. F. (2018). candyflipping And Other Combinations: Identifying Drug–drug Combinations From An Online Forum. Frontiers In Psychiatry, 9, 135.
  26. Chary, M. (2015). On The Effect Of Cocaine On The Population Dynamics Of The Lateral Habenula [PhD thesis]. icahn School Of Medicine At Mount Sinai.
  27. lui, A., Chary, M., Yoneda, N., & Parikh, S. (2018). Tracking Resident Cognitive Maturation With Natural Language Processing. Western Journal Of Emergency Medicine: Integrating Emergency Care With Population Health, 19(4.1).
  28. Chary, M., & Manini, A. (2018). Creating Sudo, The Substance Use Disorder Ontology, To Automatically Synthesize And Disseminate Substance Use Disorder Research. Annals Of Emergency Medicine, 72(4), s129–s130.
  29. Chary, M., Parikh, S., Manini, A. F., Boyer, E. W., & Radeos, M. (2019). A Review Of Natural Language Processing In Medical Education. Western Journal Of Emergency Medicine, 20(1), 78.
  30. Desai, P., Vortsman, E., Shaukat, N., & Chary, M. (2017). always Cook Your Boba. Emergency Medicine.
  31. Chary, M., Burns, M., & Boyer, E. (2019). Tak: The Computational Toxicological Machine. Clinical Toxicology, 57(6), 482–482.
  32. whitehill, J. M., Harrington, C., Lang, C. J., Chary, M., Bhutta, W. A., & Burns, M. M. (2019). Incidence Of Pediatric Cannabis Exposure Among Children And Teenagers Aged 0 To 19 Years Before And After Medical Marijuana Legalization In Massachusetts. Jama Network Open, 2(8), e199456–e199456.
  33. Chary, M., O’brien, M., Hayes, B., & Burns, M. (2019). Pharmacokinetics Is Toxicokinetics In A Massive Buproprion Ingestion. Clinical Toxicology, 57(10), 1000–1000.
  34. O’brien, M., Chary, M., Burns, M., Tom, A., Funamoto, M., & Deseda, G. C. (2019). Successful Use Of Ecmo And Lipid Emulsion For Massive Bupropion Overdose. Clinical Toxicology, 57(10), 968–969.
  35. Lee, S., Chary, M., Salehi, I., & Bansal, R. (2015). Immune-mediated Adalimumab-induced Thrombocytopenia For The Treatment Of Ulcerative Colitis. Int J Pharm Pharm Sci, 7(7), 456–458.
  36. leea, S., Chary, M., Salehi, I., & Bansal, R. Immune-mediated Adalimumab-induced Thrombocytopenia For The Treatment Of Ulcerative Colitis.

  38. Chary, M. A., Manini, A. F., Boyer, E. W., & Burns, M. (2020). The Role And Promise Of Artificial Intelligence In Medical Toxicology. Journal Of Medical Toxicology, 1–7.
  39. andrew, M., Chary, M., Manini, A., Park, E. H., Sun, J., & Genes, N. (2013). towards An Analysis Of Youtube Comments On Drug Health Effects. Amia.
  40. Chary, M., Ellango, K., & Burns, M. (2020). patterns Of 2, 4-dinitrophenol Use As Discussed On Social Media. Medrxiv.
  41. Chary, M. A., Barbuto, A. F., Izadmehr, S., Hayes, B. D., & Burns, M. M. (2020). covid-19: Therapeutics And Their Toxicities. j Med Toxicol, 16(3), 10–1007.
  42. Chary, M., Overbeek, D., Papadimoulis, A., Sheroff, A., & Burns, M. (2020). geospatial Correlation Between Covid-19 Health Misinformation On Social Media And Poisoning With Household Cleaners. Medrxiv.
  43. Chary, M., Genes, N., Mckenzie, A., & Manini, A. F. (2013). Leveraging Social Networks For Toxicovigilance. Journal Of Medical Toxicology, 9(2), 184–191.
